description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5sob3","text":"Glycosylation of cell surface, secreted, and circulating proteins is one of the most common types of post-translational modification. These modifications occur most commonly as one of three major classes: N-linked glycosylation on asparagine residues, O-linked glycosylation on serine or threonine residues, or as glycosaminoglycan oligosaccharide polymers on serine. Specifically, for N linked glycans, an endoglycosidase enzyme, peptide N-glycosidase F (PNGase F), cleaves the attached oligosaccharides between the asparagine and first sugar. A method to analyze released N-glycans and map them to specific locations within a tissue is presented here. The PNGase F is applied by solvent sprayer as a molecular layer on frozen or formalin-fixed tissues and all released Nglycans in a given region of tissue are detected using matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization (MALDI) imaging mass spectrometry (MALDI-IMS). Using the described MALDI-IMS protocol, at least 40 or more individual N-glycans can be mapped to tissue histopathology and extracted for further structural analysis approaches.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f7scg","text":"You can either use MIBI stain dewax_protocol or the protocol in Drake's published protocol. Here we adapted Drake's protocol into our oven settings in R139. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ce61r","text":"The purpose of antigen retrieval is to breakup the cross linking between the amino side chain of lysines and make the tissue more approachable for PNGase F. The preferred antigen retrieval buffer is the Citraconic acid buffer (pH3) in Drake's protocol. However, based on our experience, MIBI AR protocol and AmberGen AR protocol are all compatible with PNGase F digestion. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3r5uu","text":"This step is to let PNGase F cleave off the N-glycan from tissue on the solid phase. The cleaved off N-glycan will stay at its specific location and hence provide spacial information. Before the incubation step, if you messed up the spraying step, you can wash the slide with HPLC water, dry the slide and spray again. However, after the incubation step, when N-glycans got cleaved off the tissue, the tissue need to be dry. A drop of water will dissolve the N-glycans and compeletly kill the spacial information. After the PNGase F incubation step, if you took slide (vacuum sealed bag) from the freezer, let the vacuum bag warm up to room temperature first and then open the bag. Exposing a cold slide to atmosphere will lead to moisture condensation on the tissue. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6vbv","text":"Optical image will be used for setting up a MALDI run with flexImaging software. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"548u9","text":"Prepared slides could be placed in mailer, sealed in a vacuum seal bag and store at -20 °C for up to a month before MALDI acquisition. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7tn5k","text":"FFPE tissue slides for MIBI and other epitope based stain protocol are usually stored in vacuum sealed bag with anti oxidant and drying agent. FFPE tissue slides for N-glycan IMS can be stored the same way as MIBI slides. However, slides left on bench top at room temperature exposed to atmosphere over a year can be used for N-glycan IMS as well.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ilh0","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lal","text":"Formalin fixed tissues should be sectioned at 3~7 µm and mounted on slides. For MALDI-FT-ICR and MALDI-QTOF, standard microscope slides, positively charged microscope slides or epoxide coated microscope slides are suitable as long as they fit into the 25 x 75 mm slide holder for the instrument. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ddovk","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1q8l","text":"If a slide with tissue does not fit the sample holder for the instrument, it may be sized to fit while the tissue is still covered with wax, as this prevents contamination and limits damage to the tissue. A small hand held rotary tool may be used to grind down slide edges to fit into the instrument sample holder. Afterwards, slides may be lightly rinsed in tap water and allowed to air dry.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2o7ap","text":"     ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1gdvs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"237321C001AA11EE8C7F8B81D30F259F","height":263,"id":378358,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"cq87f\",\"text\":\"MTP target frame III (Bruker, Part No.: 8074115)\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtr2bprn7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtrybprn7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtrzbprn7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtrxbprn7.webp","width":423}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C6FF261003DD11EEB20A3518A8741FED","height":158,"id":378362,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"ftgfu\",\"text\":\"A hand holder rotatory tool.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtr6bprn7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtr4bprn7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtr5bprn7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtr3bprn7.webp","width":294}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51a1h","text":"Heat slides at 70°C (face up) for one hour, and then at 70°C (perpendicular) for 10 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1j9sl","text":"Remove and cool to room temperature, usually 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0icq","text":"You can do dewax washes the same way as for MIBI slide. Or you can just use plastic/glass Coplin jars and let the slide sit in the solution. Here are the sequential washing solutions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g04b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h12f","text":"- Xylenes 3 minutes, repeating a total of two times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqgj0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akpch","text":"- 100% ethanol 1 minute, repeating a total of two times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9tiq0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvh1c","text":"- 95% ethanol 1 minute","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehp74","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cau20","text":"- 70% ethanol 1 minute","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c81nc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ekso","text":"- Distilled water 3 minutes, repeating a total of two times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b58ch","text":"Slides may be stored overnight in vacuum desiccator. Dry slides could be placed in a mailer, sealed in a vacuum sealed bag and stored in freezer overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

A new bottle should be used if white crystal is observed inside the bottle or around the bottle opening area. Pleas do not use plastic pipet to take liquid from the original citraconic anhydride bottle. Use disposable glass pipet with pipet bulb or syringe with Luer solo (NO black rubber on tip, which will dissolve with organic solvent and cause contamination). \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtsebprn7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtscbprn7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtsdbprn7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtsbbprn7.webp","width":121.16438356164393}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1tbn","text":"Cool the slides after antigen retrieval:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvoch","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8tq9","text":"- Remove mailer and place in a tub with cool water from the faucet. Water should not go over the top of the mailer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b101","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ega7l","text":"- Allow to cool for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48ihq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv931","text":"- Remove half the buffer from the mailer and replace with distilled water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ujff","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ak7kv","text":"- Allow to cool 5 minutes on countertop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70tih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k5tf","text":"- Repeat removal of half the buffer two more times, each with 5 minutes of cooling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4o3sf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a11m","text":"- Complete by rinsing in 100% distilled water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4lms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co1e2","text":"- Dry the slides with Kimwipes (don't touch the tissue). And dry slides at least 5 min in a desiccator, then proceed to the PNGaseF digestion steps. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22nta","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"al7u8","text":"Prepare PNGase F solution:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97bon","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2d18","text":"- Prepare 0.1 µg/µl PNGaseF in water using aliquots from the -20°C freezer. The original tube (contain 100 µg PNGaseF lyophilized powder) could only take 0.5 mL water. Pipet 0.5 mL water into the that original tube,  transfer out to a 1.5 mL glass flask or eppendorf tube. Repeat for one more time. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bl8at","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ff85","text":"- Ensure that enough solution is prepared, e.g, four slides takes approximately 1 mL of solution; for one slide, take 0.5 mL solution. Once you select the spraying area, HTX sprayer will give you an estimate. Please add 0.25 mL dead volume to that estimate volume. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39h6t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2cv7k","text":"  - If you only spray one slide, you will only need 0.5 mL of the above prepared PNGase sln. Please pipet 0.5 mL PNGase sln from the glass vail back to the original tube. Write down a date and volume on the original tube,  and place the tube back into MALDI freezer. This leftover PNGase sln. could be used for training purpose. Wipe off the condensation before rotating the slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86j0v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gajc","text":"- Store the slide in a mailer to protect the released glycans. It is preferred to immediately spray matrix onto the slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"grr3","text":"Mark fiducials at the four corners of each slide.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv2el","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da286","text":"Fiducials are points of reference used when “teaching” the instrument software (flexImaging) the coordinates of the slide. {"blocks":[{"key":"27ol5","text":"Prepare the CHCA matrix:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79ggn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u5f0","text":"- Prepare CHCA matrix (sealed with para film and stored in freezer) at 7 mg/mL in 50% acetonitrile/0.1% TFA. Add 0.042g CHCA to 6ml 50% acetonitrile/0.1% TFA. Prepare fresh each time in a 50 mL falcon tube. 6 mL CHCA solution is enough for 4 slides. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clj03","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aaest","text":"- Vortex violently (5~10 min) until most solid dissolve.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nb5r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f04kh","text":"- After vortex, small chunks may remain in the bottom of the falcon tube, which will clog the components of the TMsprayer.  Filter CHCA solution using Millex (Millipore) 0.2µm PTFE syringe filter will completely remove the solid.  Make sure to cap the filtered solution. As the acetonitrile evaporate, crystal may appear again. If this happened, filtration need to be performed again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aatj4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"u6n1","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d688i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AB980E8003E411EE9A06CD21CF43837F","height":158,"id":378474,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"5ghis\",\"text\":\"Luer Solo syringe is compatible with organic solvent. There is NO rubber septum inside the syringe, which will dissolve in organic solvent and cause contamination. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvnbprn7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvkbprn7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvmbprn7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvjbprn7.webp","width":317}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BD6DCAA003E411EE9A06CD21CF43837F","height":136,"id":378478,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"8cnq7\",\"text\":\"0.2µm PTFE syringe filter. PTFE membrane is compatible with organic solvent. While PVDF membrane is not. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvsbprn7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvqbprn7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvrbprn7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvpbprn7.webp","width":317}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ead6j","text":"Spray a dummy slide with CHCA solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25hjr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f59e4","text":"- Place the tubing (labelled as \"Matrix\") of port D into the matrix solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egj2f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mlkk","text":"- On HTX sprayer software interface, click \"Method\" (left column) --\u003e choose \"CHCA_dry\" --\u003e confirm the parameters: solvent (50%ACN, 0.1%TFA), concentration (7 mg/mL), nozzle temperature (77°C), pressure (10 psi), Track space (3 mm),  flow rate (70 µL/min), velocity (1300), number of passes (14), , dry time (0), pattern (cc), Prime Script (Matrix Line), Flush Script (Organic solvent Flush), Wash Script (Base/Acid Wash(Matrix)) --\u003e Click on \"Select This Method\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aaf63","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8e18u","text":"- Click on \"Open Tray Drawer\" --\u003e  tape the dummy slide into the sprayer. --\u003e click on \"Close Tray drawer\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r4pg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4rf1","text":"- Click on \"Sample\" --\u003e drag the red rectangle to define the spraying area. --\u003e click on \"Confirm Spray Area\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cvrr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3c4ua","text":"- Click on \"Home\", check whether the right method is chosen. click on the green \"Cycle Start\" button and follow the instructions on the HTX sprayer software. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqjf0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95otj","text":"- when the spray start, pay attention to two things: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f56bp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jaur","text":"1st, is there a consistent tail made from light yellow solid on the slide? Does the length of the tail make sense? Too long a tail means solvent does not evaporated efficiently. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"elqte","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27r1","text":"2nd, when the spraying finished, there should be a fine layer of yellow solid on the slide. Pay attention to the thickness of the yellow and the particle size of the matrix. Compare with lab used slides (previously prepared, went through N-glycan IMS acquisition and gave decent Images) to evaluate the quality of your CHCA spray. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9F6ABB3003DA11EEB20A3518A8741FED","height":313,"id":378482,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvwbprn7.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvubprn7.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvvbprn7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mtvtbprn7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5k39n","text":"Prepare the HTX spray the same way as in section 4.3. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cro4d","text":"Spray CHCA on tissue slide","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2t1vo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fm3n6","text":"- After dummy slide run finished, Click on \"Open Tray Drawer\" --\u003e  tape the tissue slide into the sprayer. --\u003e click on \"Close Tray drawer\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fj45","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kmg8","text":"- click on \"repeat cycle\", if you want to spray exact the same area as dummy slide; Then the spray will begin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nnsd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74jb0","text":"- click on \"new cycle\", if you will change the spraying area. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1g4oa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"g9ts","text":"- Click on \"Sample\" --\u003e Click on the 1~4 slide arrangement pictures to get the red rectangle--\u003e drag the red rectangle to define the spraying area. --\u003e click on \"confirm spray area\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5263k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23u05","text":"- Click \"start\" and follow the instructions form the sprayer.
